page.title: 17GIANT HOGWEED West Forres
page.content: Along the banks of the River Findhorn and on waste ground Giant Hogweed is increasingly becoming a problem.It is a tall coarse herb which grows up to two metres high.It has a grooved,hairy,hollow stem and if the stem is broken it releases a white juice which,if is in contact with skin it causes a very bad burn.It can leave some skins sensitive to strong sunlight and a recurrent rash.Hogweed is becoming increasingly difficult to eradicate.It is not listed under the Weed Act.The seeds are washed down river but riparian landowners are not permitted to use weed-killer in case this causes pollution.Unless all landowners help tackle the problem in the same year the seeds will continue to disperse and the problem will escalate.
